involvement and being a student at our tiny community college unfortunately that visibility makes dating hard everyone knows i have a partner at home and smalltown gossip is very real there are also certain social spaces i cant safely explore without raising eyebrows on top of that i genuinely hate online dating and im demi i need to know someone is a good intelligent trustworthy person before anything sexual can happen otherwise my libido just doesnt turn on that already limits my options a lot and being rural shrinks the pool even further in the last 3 years ive had exactly two dates one a true disaster date 1 i met a sweet guy at a local carnival and thought a small fling might be a good place to start we communicated mostly via google translate from this date i learned s muy poco espaol when we sat down to eat he told me he was looking for a wife to bring his family to the us i think there was a misunderstanding about enm due to the language barrier he was kind just not looking for a casual connection so i ended it after the date weve run into each other during the two carnivals since and hes always polite and warm date 2 i went out with an older man i met on a nature path and we hit it off he asked me out that night dinner was great things felt promising and he even kissed me once then at the bar he pulled up his shirt to show me his tattoos which turned out to be a whole collection of whitesupremacy symbols immediate hard no i ended the date on the spot and he left after making some racist comments about who id see next he then stalked and harassed me for three weeks wrote things on my front door and was eventually arrested not just for what he did to me but also for allegedly groping a teenager in another town during that time bullet dodged this was in march of this year 2025 thankfully i havent heard from him since meanwhile my partner has had a lot of success in our enm dynamic he dates has fulfilling fwb connections and all his breakups have been amicable we have veto power neither of us has used it and whoever someone dates must message the other partner before things become intimate just to establish respect and transparency every woman hes been with has been kind thoughtful and lovely in those messages im genuinely proud of his choices he keeps encouraging me to try again and i want to i have some kinks im curious to explore and hes excited to explore them with me at my pace but i feel like im terrible at picking partners im still embarrassed and ashamed i let a nazi kiss me even though my partner keeps reminding me that lots of men lie or hide things to get laid and i didnt choose him i was deceived still ive learned i need to ask certain dealbreaker questions before the date ive only had a handful of partners in my life and i do have a sexualassault history so i know i can be overly cautious with men my partner has way more experience in dating and in enm and i genuinely appreciate that i benefit from his wisdom in a lot of ways hes supportive encouraging and we have a beautiful strong relationship in and out of the bedroom he has offered to return to monogamy so we can both get ahead of feeling resentful since i havent been with anyone but him but i really am benefitting from this system we have and in this situation him dating or not dating does not even factor into my selfpity i want this too and have been eager to experience it for myself im confident that im just as lovely as the women my partner chooses so this selfconsciousness negging me from the back of my mind is incredibly frustrating and new and i dont like it one bit my question are there better criteria i should be using for selecting who and where and how i date in a rural area as a demi person is there a flaw in my approach that im not seeing am i just bad at this i really dont want to end up in a onesided enm dynamic but right now it feels like im failing at this any advice or perspective would be so appreciated friends

the infinity nobody needs why maths biggest assumption might be optional the question nobody asks in 1891 a mathematician named georg cantor proved something that broke math wide open some infinities are bigger than others his proof is taught in every college math course its elegant rigorous and considered bulletproof but heres what nobody tells you the proof assumes the thing its trying to prove not in a way that makes it wrong its perfectly valid logic but in a way that makes it optional the proof only works if you already accept that completed infinities are real things you can reason about and nothing in nature forces you to accept that how the proof works the 2minute version cantor wanted to show that real numbers like 2 0333 cant be put in a list the way counting numbers can heres his trick step 1 pretend you can list all real numbers between 0 and 1 1st 014159 2nd 071828 3rd 057721 and so on forever step 2 now go diagonally down the list and change each digit change the 1st digit of the 1st number change the 2nd digit of the 2nd number change the 3rd digit of the 3rd number keep going forever step 3 this creates a new number thats different from every number on your list conclusion your complete list wasnt complete you cant list all real numbers therefore theyre uncountably infinite a bigger infinity than the counting numbers the proof works but look at what it assumes the hidden assumption for this to work you need to believe that an infinite list can be completed that it exists as a finished object you can manipulate this is called actual infinity treating like a thing not a process but heres the catch mathematics doesnt prove actual infinities exist it assumes they exist through something called the axiom of infinity and then explores what follows cantors proof shows if completed infinities exist then they come in different sizes thats valid but it doesnt prove the if part even gdels incompleteness theorem tells us no math system can prove its own rules are consistent including the rule that says infinity can be completed so were not talking about truth were talking about which assumptions you choose to work with what physics actually shows now look at the real universe every physical limit ever measured is finite information capacity maximum information in a region scales with its surface area not volume bekensteinhawking bound planck length space cant be divided smaller than 10 meters observable universe finite age finite size finite particle count 10 quantum states always discrete when you actually measure them pattern nature keeps showing us finitude even if the numbers are huge if the universe is fundamentally discrete with finite information capacity then actual infinities might never physically exist theyd be like frictionless planes or perfect vacuums useful for calculations but not literally real the real question can you tell the difference heres a thought experiment imagine two universes universe a uncountably infinite real numbers exist as completed mathematical objects universe b a finite computer runs forever generating real numbers on demand whenever you need them question can you tell which universe youre in in universe b at any moment only finitely many numbers have been generated but theres always more time to generate more you get as many as you need whenever you need them inside either universe no experiment can tell them apart both give you access to as many real numbers as you want both make the same predictions but one requires uncountable infinities to exist and the other doesnt if theyre operationally identical why assume the more complicated one is real the backwards intuition most people think infinite possibilities randomness chaos unpredictability finite constraints determinism rigid outcomes but the math says the opposite in quantum mechanics particles are described by path integrals sums over all possible paths if those paths are truly infinite and continuous they would cancel each other out perfectly youd get a single definite classical trajectory determinism but if paths are finite in number even if huge cancellation is incomplete probability spreads survive indeterminism the reason quantum mechanics is probabilistic might be because the universe is finite not despite it the famous doubleslit experiment where particles create interference patterns might not be proof of infinite possibilities it might be proof of astronomically large but finite possibilities that cant quite cancel perfectly what this means if the universe is fundamentally finite 1 the continuum is an approximation like how water looks smooth but is really molecules math using continuous functions works because the finite structure is so finegrained but the substrate underneath is countable and discrete 2 probability isnt mysterious not about wave function collapse not about multiple worlds just finite sets cant achieve perfect cancellation the leftover spread is what we call probability 3 uncountable infinities are tools not truth useful for calculations elegant for proofs but not required to describe what we actually observe the test if substrate is truly finite there should be observable effects though incredibly tiny interference patterns should have a resolution floor a minimum graininess that no perfect detector can eliminate should scale with wavelength and distance in a specific way different from normal detector limits early universe structures jwst is already seeing galaxies too big too early for standard models consistent with structure forming suddenly rather than gradually quantum correlations over cosmic distances should degrade slightly beyond normal decoherence because substrate has finite capacity to maintain correlations none of these have been definitively seen yet but theyre the kind of thing youd look for if you suspected the continuum was an approximation not reality the bottom line cantors proof is mathematically perfect within systems that assume actual infinities exist but that assumption is a choice not a discovery physics shows us finite information capacity discrete spectra bounded regions quantized measurements nothing requires uncountable infinities everything is compatible with finitude the continuum might be like newtonian mechanics an incredibly good approximation that works perfectly at the scales we can measure but not the deepest description of reality the real question if a universe with 10 particles can calculate to a trillion digits but never finish all real numbers and thats operationally identical to a universe where all reals exist why assume the uncountable version is real if you cant tell the difference why pay the metaphysical price maybe infinity isnt wrong maybe its just optional and if the universe runs on finite substrate then maths biggest assumption that completed infinities are real turns out to be the luxury we never needed want to go deeper this argument is one thread in a larger framework that asks what if forces arent fundamental but accounting systems what if the big bang was collapse into finitude not creation from nothing what if dark matter and energy are artifacts of finite substrate full framework final thought infinity is elegant finitude is sufficient between elegance and sufficiency nature tends to choose sufficiency maybe we should too

adventurous spirit at young age hi i have adopted a young syrian hamster around a month ago when he was told to be 56 weeks i do have to add that he came from the pets store where he was kept in terrifying tiny space since then he has been adjusting extremely well making burrows using the wheel hoarding playing in sand bath chewing on toys and other wooden structures etc he has a bucaste 20 150x50x50 with plenty of variety of beddings sprays toys dig boxes and hides to the point that now i cannot possibly fit more new things for him he seems quite social as after very short period of adjustment he started coming to my hand and is no longer afraid even tiny bit now the issue is anytime he sees me im a night owl so everyday for many hours he begs to go out and tries to climb the top of the cage or bite through side holes for air i think he mostly stops when i go to sleep but i do not have a camera to be 100 sure i tried to move items many times around to stop him from accessing those ventilation spots but he started climbing on the top of the wheel to reach it so at the end i left those places accessible with the safe drop height and extra bedding he learnt to do pull ups and other very athletic movements i wouldnt think he can achieve however today he was so determinate that he managed to bend the metal on top of the cage inside the letter b and proceed to start going out but i noticed in time and now covered this with a book on top when we out in the playpen for often 2h that is around 3m by 2 with stairs back to the cage if he needs something after short time of exploring toys he mostly tries to escape by biting panels etc i guess after all i just wanted to ask from your all experiences did your hamster grow calmer as they grow up or remained explorers forever i can deal with him when he is outside but cannot stop worrying at his acrobatics and drops inside the cage

zero cost shortcut for cluster structure seconds in python no dft subscription needed im an independent researcher working on a new geometry based framework tq that originally had nothing to do with chemistry after getting fast desk rejections from every major physics outlet with no engagement and i understand why i went back to the original scientific method and started making predata predictions let the experiments decide whether the model is real for someone in my position thats the only honest path while stress testing how far the geometry could scale i pushed it into molecular space i wasnt expecting anything but the model gave me h2o dimer oo separation 2910 angstrom experimental about 280 angstrom computed in under one second on basic python no dft engine no xc functional no pseudopotentials no licenses no gpu just a shell overlap curvature model locked to the proton no adjustable parameters no curve fitting if this holds up chemists might be able to offload a lot of exploratory work like quick structure baselines relaxation trends rdf shifts early cluster screening runs etc without paying the dft tax every time then only send the publication cases to dft has there ever been a quantum physics model that crossed into chemistry at this scale with zero fitting and still land close to experiment surprised me as much as anyone prediction paper with all code sharing in case anyone in compchem is interested or wants to explore i suspect the model explains a few physical chemistry anomalies but thats a longer conversation

a tribute to one of americas first steps into the stars the goddard space flight center since 1959 the goddard space flight center is among nasas first space flight complexes and home to the nations largest organization of scientists engineers and technologists who build spacecraft instruments and new technology to study earth the sun our solar system and the universe it has been involved in designing building and operating spacecraft since the days of explorer 1 the nations first artificial satellite this is where the hubble space telescope is controlled where the james webb space telescope was developed and is controlled as well as the osirisrex asteroid sample return missions

avoid the pitfall of cheap moves a comprehensive guide on what to watch out for buyer beware the temptation to opt for the cheapest moving options might seem like a budgetfriendly choice at first glance but its essential to pause and consider the implications navigating through the maze of moving companies can be overwhelming especially when the price plays a crucial role in your decisionmaking the temptation to opt for the cheapest moving options might seem budgetfriendly at first glance but its essential to pause and consider the implications embarking on a move with the lowest bid may not always translate into savings the allure of cheap moves can often lead to compromises in safety reliability and peace of mind from stolen goods to delayed deliveries the cheapest movers arent always the best way to move to avoid cheap moves its crucial to delve deeper and understand the real cost behind the most affordable moving options this guide gives you the knowledge to navigate the pitfalls of lowcost moving services emphasizing why choosing the cheapest move can be the wrong decision youll learn how to gauge moving quotes effectively ensuring the lowest price does not seduce you but rather guided by value expertise and security we will explore the significance of insurance the value of reviews and the red flags that signal when to steer clear of toogoodtobetrue offers buyer beware the quest for affordable moving options shouldnt lead you into the traps of inefficiency and risk lets embark on a journey to make informed decisions and secure a move thats not only costeffective but safe and smooth the risks of lowcost moving services opting for the cheapest moving options can be tempting when planning a move aiming to save money however this decision might lead to more expenses and stress than anticipated lets explore the risks associated with lowcost moving services 1 hidden costs and surprises initially attractive low quotes might not include various fees leading to a final cost much higher than anticipated be wary of packing and unpacking services fees charges for moving large or special items lastminute fees due to unforeseen circumstances 2 service quality and reliability untimely services delays in arrival or longer transport times can disrupt your moving schedule possibly incurring additional costs potential damage and inexperience the risk of damage to your belongings increases with inexperienced movers which could lead to significant loss or breakage liability and insurance issues in many cases you are responsible for damages especially if the moving company lacks proper insurance 3 stress and unreliability factors bait and switch tactics extremely low estimates might be a strategy to win your business only for the costs to skyrocket once your belongings are loaded flybynight operations the internet is rife with brokers and companies that disappear overnight leading to scams and unreliable service unrealistic promises be cautious of companies that promise unusually quick delivery times as these often lead to disappointment and delays buyer beware while the allure of saving money is strong the cheapest moving options are often the wrong decision the potential for hidden fees increased stress and the risk of damage to your possessions should make you think twice opting for a moving company that balances cost and quality service is crucial for a smooth and stressfree move understanding the real cost of your move understanding the real cost of your move goes beyond just looking at the initial moving quotes it involves considering various factors that contribute to the overall expenses heres a breakdown to help you grasp the comprehensive costs associated with moving preparation and services furniture handling expect charges for furniture disassembly and reassembly these will add to your costs if you require unpacking support or box return services additional services be prepared for extra costs for services like packing or storage these can significantly increase your moving budget professional moving company operations salaries and benefits professional moving companies offer their employees competitive salaries and benefits packages including health insurance and 401k plans this can influence the overall cost business operations the cost estimation processes truck rental or purchase marketing and employee hiring all factor into the quotes you receive quotes and charges obtaining quotes always obtain at least three written inhome estimates to avoid future pricing disputes be wary of unusually low estimates or those provided without a physical inspection additional charges watch out for potential additional charges such as administrative fees additional mileage fees and complexity fees a deposit should not exceed 20 of the estimated cost and paying with a credit card for potential charge disputes is advisable when considering the cheapest moving options its crucial to remember that these often come with risks such as hidden fees less reliable service and the potential for damage or loss of your belongings the allure of saving upfront can lead to greater expenses and stress down the line understanding the real cost of your move involves looking at the full picture including the professionalism and reliability of the moving company to make an informed decision that ensures a smooth and successful move the importance of insurance and liability protection understanding the nuances of insurance and liability protection is crucial when planning your move especially if the cheapest moving options tempt you heres a breakdown to help you navigate the complexities of moving insurance and ensure your belongings are protected types of coverage released value protection this is the most essential coverage often included at no additional cost in interstate moves it offers minimal protection compensating at 60 cents per pound per item which may not suffice for valuable belongings full value protection this is a more comprehensive option covering the repair replacement or reimbursement of items at their current market value while offering better coverage its important to note that it might not cover items of extraordinary value unless they are specifically listed thirdparty insurance for those seeking additional peace of mind thirdparty insurance can supplement the movers coverage offering broader protection for your items during transit and storage licensing and regulations ensure the moving company has a valid dot number and a carrier number from the federal motor carrier safety administration for interstate moves this confirms they are legally authorized to operate verify the moving companys insurance status to ensure they have the necessary coverage to protect your belongings considerations and limitations valuation vs insurance understand that valuation coverage provided by moving companies is not the same as moving insurance valuation offers a predetermined level of liability while insurance covers the actual cost of loss or damage item packing if you pack your boxes the coverage for contents may be limited some insurers only cover boxes packed by their staff highvalue items items exceeding a specific value per pound may need to be declared separately to ensure adequate coverage filing claims be prompt in reporting any loss or damage theres usually a limited window postmove to file claims for reimbursement choosing the cheapest moving option without considering the adequacy of insurance and liability protection can be a costly mistake while saving upfront is tempting the potential financial and emotional cost of lost or damaged belongings can far outweigh initial savings always weigh the value of your possessions against the level of protection offered by the movers insurance and consider supplemental insurance if necessary buyer beware the cheapest mover might not provide the coverage and peace of mind you need for a secure move experience and professionalism matter when embarking on the moving journey the allure of opting for the cheapest movers might seem tempting however this decision could lead to a path fraught with stress unreliability and potential loss the experience and professionalism of a moving company play pivotal roles in ensuring a seamless move heres why customer experience matters from the moment you start your research until the postmove feedback every interaction with the moving company shapes your experience a company that values customer satisfaction invests in training its staff and streamlining its processes to ensure smooth operations this dedication to service can boost customer loyalty encouraging repeat business and referrals online reviews and wordofmouth recommendations are gold for a moving company a positive online presence built on the back of satisfied customers can significantly expand a companys customer base conversely negative reviews can deter potential clients highlighting the importance of choosing a company with a strong digital footprint professionalism equates to peace of mind working with a professional moving company means more than just having someone to lift heavy boxes it involves a team that manages the logistics meticulously ensuring your belongings are handled with care this level of professionalism provides peace of mind knowing that your possessions are in capable hands when assessing a moving companys professionalism consider the following helpfulness and friendliness gauge this through their website and phone interactions a company thats eager to assist and answer your questions is likely to provide a better service experience look for indicators of experience such as how long theyve been in business the training their staff undergoes and reallife testimonials online presence and reviews a reputable company will have a solid online presence and positive reviews be wary of companies with no online footprint or predominantly negative feedback while the cheapest moving options might seem attractive they often come with hidden costsnot just financial but also in belongings but also the peace of mind that comes with knowing youve made the right choice remember good movers want you to be happy and their efforts to ensure a positive customer experience reflect that buyer beware opting for the cheapest move without considering these factors can lead you down a path of regret reading reviews and doing your homework before settling on a moving company its essential to dive into reviews and do thorough research heres how to approach this crucial step start with credible sources check the better business bureau bbb and the department of transportations website for any complaints or reviews these platforms offer unbiased insights into a companys performance interpreting online reviews remember 84 of people trust online reviews as much as personal recommendations look for reviews that detail the moving process especially how movers handled fragile items or their punctuality assess the credibility of reviewer profiles those with a history of diverse and balanced reviews tend to be more reliable pay attention to how a company responds to negative reviews a constructive response indicates a commitment to customer satisfaction spotting genuine vs fake reviews genuine reviews often include specific details about the experience mentioning both pros and cons and reflect a balanced perspective be cautious of reviews using vague language lacking detail about the moving process or using extreme language without specifics these could be less trustworthy in your research note that even the highestrated companies can receive bad reviews its the consistency across reviews the companys response to criticism and the detail in positive feedback that will guide you recent reviews are particularly valuable as they are more reflective of the companys current operations by doing your homework you avoid the pitfall of choosing the cheapest mover without understanding the full picture ensuring a smoother more reliable moving experience red flags to watch out for when navigating the moving process being vigilant about potential red flags can save you from unnecessary stress and financial loss here are critical warning signs to watch out for upfront demands and unprofessional practices substantial deposits if a company requests a large deposit before any service is provided tread carefully reputable moving companies typically do not demand significant upfront payments blank documents never sign incomplete or blank documents this practice leaves you vulnerable to unforeseen charges and terms baitandswitch tactics be wary if a different company shows up on moving day than the one you hired this could indicate a scam licensing and operational red flags lack of licensing proper licensing is a must for interstate moves check for a us department of transportation number absence of this or any state licensing is a major concern no physical address or comprehensive online presence a legitimate moving company should have a physical address and a detailed website a lack of these could indicate a flybynight operation transparency and communication issues no written estimate or references a reputable company provides written estimates and can offer references upon request avoid companies that fail to provide these basic elements lack of transparency a moving company should clearly outline its services pricing and policies if details are murky or communication is lacking consider it a red flag remember opting for the cheapest moving options without thorough research and consideration of these warning signs can lead to a decision you might regret buyer beware caveat emptor ensuring your chosen moving company is reputable transparent and professionally licensed is crucial for a smooth and successful move how i design software architecture hello reddit i wanted to share an educational deep dive into the programming workflow i developed for myself that finally allowed me to tackle huge complex features without introducing massive technical debt for context i used to struggle with tools like cursor and claude code they were great for small wellscoped iterations but as soon as the conceptual complexity and scope of a change grew my workflows started to break down it wasnt that the tools literally couldnt touch 1015 files it was that i was asking them to execute big fuzzy refactors without a clear staged plan like many people i went deep into the whole rules ecosystem cursor rules agentmd files skills mcps and all sorts of yamlmarkdowndriven configuration the disappointing realization was that most decisions werent actually driven by intelligence from the live codebase and largecontext reasoning but by a rigid set of rules i had written earlier over time i flipped this completely instead of forcing the models to follow an evergrowing list of brittle instructions i let the code lead the system infers intent and patterns from the actual repository and existing code becomes the real source of truth i eventually deleted most of those rule files and docs because they were going stale faster than i could maintain them instead of one giant doeverything prompt i keep the setup simple and transparent the core of the system is a small library of xml formatted prompts the prompts themselves are written with sections like identity role implementationplan and steps and they spell out exactly what the model should look at and how to shape the final output some of them are very simple like pathfinder which just returns a list of file paths or textimprovement and taskrefinement which return cleaned up descriptions as plain text others like implementationplan and implementationplanmerge define a strict xml schema for structured implementation plans so that every step file path and operation lands in the same place taken together they cover the stages of my planning pipeline from selecting folders and files to refining the task to producing and merging detailed implementation plans in the end there is no black box it is just a handful of explicit prompts and the xml or plain text they produce which i can read and understand at a glance not a swarm of opaque agents doing whoknowswhat behind the scenes my new approach revolves around the motto intelligencedriven development i stop focusing on rapid code completion and instead focus on rigorous architectural planning and governance i now reliably develop very sophisticated systems often getting to 95 correctness in almost one shot here is a stepbystep breakdown of my fivestage plancentric workflow my fivestage workflow for architectural rigor stage 1 crystallize the specification the biggest source of bugs is ambiguous requirements i start here to ensure the ai gets a crystalclear task definition 1 rapid capture i often use voice dictation because i found it is about 10x faster than typing out my initial thoughts i pipe the raw audio through a dedicated transcription specialist prompt so the output comes back as clean readable text rather than a messy stream of speech 2 contextual input if the requirements came from a meeting i even upload transcripts or recordings from places like microsoft teams i use advanced analysis to extract specification requirements decisions and action items from both the audio and visual content 3 task refinement this is crucial i use ai not just for grammar fixes but for task refinement a dedicated textimprovement taskrefinement pair of prompts rewrites my rough description for clarity and then explicitly looks for implied requirements edge cases and missing technical details this frontloaded analysis drastically reduces the chance of costly rework later one painful lesson from my earlier experiments outofdate documentation is actively harmful if you keep shoveling stale md files and handwritten rules into the prompt youre just teaching the model the wrong thing models like gpt5 and gemini 25 pro are extremely good at picking up subtle patterns directly from real code tiny needles in a huge haystack so instead of trying to encode all my design decisions into documents i rely on them to read the code and infer how the system actually behaves today stage 2 targeted context discovery once the specification is clear i strictly limit the code the model can see dumping an entire repository into a model has never even been on the table for me it wouldnt fit into the context window would be insanely expensive in tokens and would completely dilute the useful signal in practice ive always seen much better results from giving the model a small sharply focused slice of the codebase what actually provides that focused slice is not a single regex pass but a fourstage filefinderworkflow orchestrated by a workflow engine each stage builds on the previous one and is driven by a dedicated system prompt 1 root folder selection stage 1 of the workflow a rootfolderselection prompt sees a shallow directory tree up to two levels deep for the project and any configured external folders together with the task description the model acts like a smart router it picks only the root folders that are actually relevant and uses hierarchical intelligence if an entire subtree is relevant it picks the parent folder and if only parts are relevant it picks just those subdirectories the result is a curated set of root directories that dramatically narrows the search space before any file content is read 2 patternbased file discovery stage 2 for each selected root processed in parallel with a small concurrency limit a regexfilefilter prompt gets a directory tree scoped to that root and the task description instead of one big regex it generates pattern groups where each group has a pathpattern contentpattern and negativepathpattern within a group path and content must both match between groups results are ored together the engine then walks the filesystem gitaware respecting gitignore applies these patterns skips binaries validates utf8 ratelimits io and returns a list of locally filtered files that look promising for this task 3 aipowered relevance assessment stage 3 the next stage reads the actual contents of all patternmatched files and passes them in chunks to a filerelevanceassessment prompt chunking is based on real file sizes and model context windows each chunk uses only about 60 of the models input window so there is room for instructions and task context oversized files get their own chunks the model then performs deep semantic analysis to decide which files are truly relevant to the task all suggested paths are validated against the filesystem and normalized the result is an aifiltered deduplicated set of files that are relevant in practice not just by pattern 4 extended discovery stage 4 finally an extendedpathfinder stage looks for any critical files that might still be missing it takes the aifiltered files as previously identified files plus a scoped directory tree and the file contents and asks the model questions like what other files are critically important for this task given these ones this is where it finds test files local configuration files related utilities and other helpers that hang off the alreadyidentified files all new paths are validated and normalized then combined with the earlier list avoiding duplicates this stage is conservative by design it only adds files when there is a strong reason across these four stages the workflowstate carries intermediate data selected root directories locally filtered files aifiltered files so each step has the right context the result is a final list of maybe 515 files that are actually important for the task out of thousands of candidates selected based on project structure real contents and semantic relevance not just hardcoded rules stage 3 multimodel architectural planning this is where the magic happens and technical debt is prevented this stage is powered by a heavyduty implementationplan architect prompt that only plans it never writes code directly its entire job is to look at the selected files understand the existing architecture consider multiple ways forward and then emit a structured machineusable plan i do not trust one single model output i seek consensus from multiple experts 1 multiple perspectives i leverage a multimodel planning engine to generate implementation plans simultaneously from several leading models like gpt5 and gemini 25 pro the implementationplan prompt forces each model into an explicit metaplanning protocol they must explore 23 different architectural approaches list risks and reason about how well each option fits the existing patterns 2 architectural exploration because my custom system prompt mandates it each model must consider 23 different architectural approaches for the task eg a service layer approach vs an apifirst approach and identify the highestrisk aspects and mitigation strategies while doing that they lean heavily on the code snippets i selected in stage 2 models like gpt5 and gemini 25 pro are particularly good at noticing subtle patterns and invariants in those small slices of code this lets me see different valid approaches in standardized format 3 synthesis i then evaluate and rate the plans based on their architectural appropriateness for my codebase synthesizing them into a single superior implementation blueprint when i generate multiple independent plans a separate implementationplanmerge prompt acts as a chief architect that merges them into one coherent strategy while preserving the best ideas from each this ensemble approach acts as an automated robustness check reducing susceptibility to singlemodel hallucination or failure stage 4 humanintheloop governance this is the point where i stop generating new ideas and start choosing between them instead of one final plan i usually ask the system for several competing implementation plans under the hood each plan is just xml with the same standardized schema same sections same structure same kind of filelevel steps the ui then renders them as separate plans that i can flip through with simple arrows at the bottom of the screen because every plan follows the same format my brain doesnt have to reorient every time i can 1 flip between plans quickly i move back and forth between plan 1 plan 2 plan 3 with arrow keys and the layout stays identical only the ideas change 2 compare likeforlike i end up reading the same parts of each plan the highlevel summary the filebyfile steps the risky bits in the same positions that makes it very easy to spot where the approaches differ which one touches fewer files which one simplifies the data flow which one carries less migration risk 3 focus on architecture not formatting because the xml is standardized the ui can highlight just the important bits for me i dont waste time parsing formatting or wording i can stay in architect mode and think purely about tradeoffs 4 mix and tweak if plan 2 has a better data model but plan 3 has a cleaner integration path i can adjust the steps directly or mentally merge them into a final variant while i am reviewing there is also a small floating merge instructions window attached to the plans as i go through each candidate plan i can type short notes like prefer this data model keep pagination from plan 1 avoid touching auth here or plan 3s migration steps are safer that floating panel becomes my running commentary about what i actually want at the end i trigger a final merge step it feeds the xml content of all the plans i marked as valid plus my merge instructions into a dedicated implementationplanmerge architect prompt that merge step rates the individual plans understands where they agree and disagree and often combines parts of multiple plans into a single more precise and more complete blueprint the result is a final consolidated plan that actually reflects the best pieces of everything i have seen not just the opinion of a single model in a single run only after that do i move on to execution stage 5 secure execution only after the validated merged plan is approved does the implementation occur i keep the execution as close as possible to the planning context by running everything through an integrated terminal that lives in the same ui as the plans that way i do not have to juggle windows or copy things around the plan is on one side the terminal is right there next to it 1 oneclick prompts and plans the terminal has a small toolbar of customizable frequently used prompts that i can insert with a single click i can also paste the merged implementation plan into the prompt area with one click so the full context goes straight into the terminal without manual copypaste 2 bound execution from there i use whatever coding agent or cli i prefer like claude code or similar but always with the merged plan and my standard instructions as the backbone the terminal becomes the bridge that assigns the planning layer to the actual execution layer 3 history in one place all commands and responses stay in that same view tied mentally to the plan i just approved if something looks off i can scroll back compare with the plan and either adjust the instructions or go back a stage and refine the plan itself the important part is that the terminal is not magic it is just a very convenient way to keep planning and execution glued together the agent executes but the merged plan and my own judgment stay firmly in charge i found that this disciplined approach is what truly unlocks speed since the process is focused on correctness and architectural assurance the return on investment is massive one saved production incident pays for months of usage in summary i stopped letting the ai be the architect and started using it as a sophisticated multiperspective planning consultant by forcing it to debate architectural options and reviewing every file path before execution i maintain the clean architecture i need without drowning in an evergrowing pile of brittle rules and outofdate md documentation this workflow is like building a skyscraper i spend significant time on the blueprints stages 13 get multiple expert opinions and have the client me sign off on every detail phase 4 only then do i let the construction crew the coding agent start guaranteeing the final structure is sound and meets the specification
you ever get halfway through a build and realize the silhouette just isnt gonna work

misty the definitive love interest for the red ash character official art of red and misty from the game freak website a little warning before i get into this post i subscribe to the perspective that red and ash are two different versions of the same person as ash was based on the red character from the games thus ill be discussing hanadashipping red x gamemisty and mangapokeshipping pokemon specialred x pokemon specialmisty im making this post because i think theres merit in exploring the relationship between red and misty and how it contributes to pokeshipping if you consider red and ash to be two entirely separate characters and only want to hear about pokeshipping please be cautious about this post with that out of the way lets get into it something ive been thinking about a lot is that theres been a lot of hints between the red character and misty even all the way back in gen 1 the two didnt actually have a significant interaction within the games as he was just another challenger passing through her gym but this doesnt necessarily mean there was no connection between the two of them at all the above image is official art depicting red and misty together notably with her wearing an outfit closer to animemistys and getting quite close to him they were also shown together in this art official art of red and misty together featuring lisa hatfield theres also one more notable interaction between them in the pokemon yellow games which were made to be a closer reflection of the anime instead of saying youre too much when she loses misty says i cant believe i lost but whats more notable is that when she sees red she has additional lines where she boasts about being a world famous beauty and calls him sweetie funny how her showing off her beauty and flirting with red is their way of making it closer to the anime theres also some interactions in pokemon masters ex to suggest that theyre not as unfamiliar with each other as the games would imply take this bit with a grain of salt of course pokemon masters ex is not canon and has many events that did not occur in the mainline games however its still official and what is depicted there wouldnt be so without the main companys approval from a day with synga suit red thunderbolt in pokemon masters ex in a day with sygna suit red thunderbolt misty talks about the close bond between red and pikachu she also reminisces about how she was so confident that shed be able to win against pikachu during her gym battle with red but was shocked when they lost if youll allow me to be shipcrazy for a moment i also noticed how they put misty as standing closest to red during this scene theres also a story event golden bonds on pasio where its shown that misty is able to interpret reds feelings despite his silence when another character king lear is unable to certainly some closeness between them even if its just friendship here huh ill admit that pokemon masters ex is a weird case because it has ash and red existing in the same continuity they didnt even solve the is leaf actually green blue or a completely separate character debate by having blue show up along with green but they went an interesting route with it where ash only interacted with the pasio characters exclusive to the mobile game so as to not cause any disruptions by interacting with the established mainline game characters it should be noted that theres canonically multiple instances of characters from alternate universes being brought to the same space in the game so ash and red both being available doesnt necessarily mean theyre entirely separate characters unfortunately there is a scene in the johto games where misty is seen going on a date with another character some people theorize this mystery boyfriend is red but there doesnt seem to be much evidence for it however the anime actually seems to have taken note of this in the hgss quiz book we can see a depiction of mistys sweetie official hgss quizbook art of mistys interrupted date doesnt he look familiar it was actually pointed out that he was the basis for the character georgio who asked misty out on a date famously there was actually a subonly line where misty rejected him because she had feelings for someone else someone who psyduck seemed to know about i think we all know who that is even in the games this character wound up running away from the date when the player showed up so theres still hope we know from the anime that even when misty has shown interest in others her heart always wandered back to a certain someone georgio and misty in the episode a date with delcatty but theres evidence for misty being the love interest for the red character in other media besides the games the most popular media depicting the characters outside of the games and anime is without a doubt pokemon special localized in englishspeaking spaces as pokemon adventures im going to be going into some spoiler territory for this manga as well as some other media so if youd like to go into it blind its best if you stop reading here in pokemon special red and misty form a fast friendship when he saves her by jumping in to battle against her corrupted gyarados while shes injured theres even a whole arc where red is flirting with her maids while resting at her mansion yeah shes a rich girl here which distracts him both from his training and his budding friendship with misty this culminates in a scene where misty is sobbing and blushing as she says i thought you knew how i felt and feeling betrayed because he wasnt focusing on their dynamic as a team how does red respond to this by taking her hand smiling at her and saying that he was in the wrong and they should train together aww panels from chapter 180 of pokemon special read righttoleft misty is outright confirmed to have feelings for red in this manga making mangapokeshipping semicanon just like pokeshipping is semicanon the romantic tension between red and misty is even commented on by green blue in japan leaf in the games who teases them about it reds feelings are more ambiguous but its notable how he had a character development arc where the lesson was pretty much stop flirting with those other girls and focus on your deeper companionship with misty theres also the above part where he stammers when he answers her and theres even a heart thumping sound going on above them thats focused more on reds side of the panel for some pokeshippers this might feel like too far off of a hint ash and specialred are two vastly different interpretations of the red character after all so surely they have nothing to do with each other right i have to point out that red in the manga was also saved from drowning by misty which was noted to be one of the key pokeshipping moments when it happened in the 2000 movie while that hint may be written off as a coincidence this one seems more overt a photo from pocket monsters color special an art book mato the original artist for pokespe drew these artworks of ash and misty from the anime notably ash is drawn the same way red is usually people who make a distinction between ash and red tend to depict them with differing characteristics like personality hair color and style and more but beyond the slightly tanned skin from the anime ash and red are basically drawn as the same person in a different outfit misty is also drawn the same way as her game counterpart ill admit this is more speculative but i can only conclude mato also saw them as two different versions of the same person ironically making mangapokeshipping a lot closer to the pokeshipping of the anime than the hanadashipping of the games despite their similarities pokemon special isnt the only media depicting the red character having romantic tension with misty theres also pokemon zensho which is a piece of media where the line between ash and red is blurred the most despite the manga following the game continuity and using the game plot and design for the red character the name used for the character is satoshi theres really no ambiguity here as for satoshis dynamic here with misty or should i say kasumi a page from chapter 2 of pokemon zensho read right to left he blushes stutters and thinks about how cute she is i dont think much elaboration is needed here they have an adorable moment where she teaches him how to swim when she founds out he and pikachu are unable to and she opens up to him about her seel saving her from drowning as a child heres one thing about zensho thats really interesting theres a plot where team rocket attempts to attack kasumi and steal seel by using a gyarados against her which makes her freeze in fear this causes satoshi to jump to protect her isnt this similar to pokemon special where red also protected misty from an attacking gyarados there was even a scene in a later chapter of pokespe where he shielded mistys body with his to protect her against team rocket this is also similar to misty of the anime who had childhood trauma with a gyarados that caused her to be frightened of them and it hardly needs to be said that the ash of the anime is rate my pota tierlist whats yours context i am someone who is much more attracted to films that seek to provoke intelligent reflection than those that offer simple bland entertainment as such i have judged the films almost entirely on this criterion rank s perfection the original pentalogy deals with racism in society and quite obviously and explicitly with the treatment of black people at the time of the pentalogy conquest of the planet of the apes is the film that marks the peak the climax of this theme adding the themes of the decline of the system the enslavement and segregation of a population and liberation through revolt for me this film is perfect within its pentalogy and the most balanced as for the first film planet of the apes there is no need to explain that it is the great classic that started the adaptations on the other hand it is extremely interesting to observe the psychological evolution of colonel taylor who is disillusioned with humanity and who gradually timidly returns to the path of hope for humanity paradoxically because of the actions of the apes and their treatment of him and his fellow humans until the end of the film which gives him a good reason to relapse into his faults which are visible in the second film rank a the third film in the original pentalogy was very well constructed in preparing the viewer for its sequel escape from the planet of the apes was a very interesting film in terms of how humans treated cornelius and zira positively although my favourite character in this film is dr otto hasslein who quickly understood the risk posed by the arrival of these chimpanzees in their world despite their pacifism it is interesting to note the dichotomy between dr hasslein who understands the risk and the other members of the commission as well as his audience who see little beyond the peaceful nature of cornelius and zira although he is portrayed as an antagonist i think his decision to prevent the downfall of humanity at all costs is commendable only cornelius and ziras escape created a point of no return triggering the need for their deaths let us now move on to the second film in the reboot trilogy it ranks in the a category because it focuses heavily on the diplomatic difficulties of creating peace when it comes to restoring an entire people struggling for survival the film is very comprehensive in its treatment of this fragile diplomacy and it was fascinating to observe the difficulties encountered by humans because of koba who put obstacles in their way unfortunately this is understandable given what he suffered at the hands of humans having never had any positive contact with them thanks tom felton youre responsible for this mess i think this reboot series could very well have ended after this second film and that the ending everyone in their own corner for a shared planet without violence was enough on its own to explain how we got to the planet of the apes presented in the first film of the original pentalogy in the chronological timeline the reboot series takes place after taylor is sent into space and ends before he returns to earth rank b i wont dwell on the first film in the reboot series as its a prequel explaining how the planet of the apes came into being lets just say that its a beautiful story and an interesting development for caesar who after seeing the good side of humanity in the person of will rodman thank you james franco discovers the bad side of humanity in the person of dodge landon a nice nod to the characters of dodge and landon from the first film in 1968 caesars evolution is the most psychological aspect of the script and therefore the most interesting in my eyes which prevents the film from falling into the c category as for the second and final film in this b category it is classified as such due to a lack of balance between its psychological and intellectual content and its boom boom gun fight action content indeed apart from the labour camps the character of the colonel played by woody harrelson and the little girl who gives caesar hope for a better future human generation there is not much other intelligent content and the rest is limited to action scenes i wont mention the comic relief provided by the new fearful and clumsy monkey which was completely unnecessary rank c we begin with the sequel to the climactic film of the original pentalogy which seems less ambitious due to a lack of budget for production sets makeup etc however the issues addressed are very interesting caesars difficulties in reconciling humanity and simianity is there a word for that moral rules being established in the early stages of a society of apes an ape shall not kill an ape and the violation of these moral rules by an ape himself ultimately causing the apes to become even more humanlike as the underused character of macdonald points out at the end despite these themes the film remains much less ambitious than its predecessor and it shows to the point that i couldnt rank it in either category a or b as for the second film in this ranking i placed it here somewhat by default because it is the least worst of the remaining films and it is simply beautiful and well made visually speaking i know i said i preferred the psychological aspect but i am not 100 focused on that overall i had a hard time finding the right position for these last three films so i would say that in terms of production its the least bad of the three however its not good at all and i was disappointed when i went to see it at the cinema its a film without any major psychological issues you just have to put your brain next to your popcorn to enjoy it they could have explored the development of caesars civilisation and his legacy a little more than we see eg falconry but no the director doesnt even try i had a glimmer of hope for the character of trevathan a human who seemed to have completely accepted his status as an outcast slave to the apes but no his character is not developed any further than that a disappointment in the making for a film that is absolutely unnecessary just like those in the d category below rank d i really dont want to talk about it like really tim burtons film is full of clichs with an antagonist monkey who is far too human for his time in his thirst for power the only thing i liked was the area called calima equivalent to the forbidden zone in the original pentalogy in the reboot the fact that this area is called calima because those are the words not covered by sand on the caution live animals sign showing that the space station crashed is the only slightly interesting element in the film now lets move out of the frying pan into the fire with the last movie of this tierlist beneath the planet of the apes is a truly awful film honestly the script is on a par with a television film not a cinema film apart from the monstrous amount of inconsistencies and incoherencies created among other things by the change in dr zaius personality who seems to no longer care about hiding the truth about his peoples origins as well as the fact that the film rushes through brents progression in this world in a desperate attempt not to create a clone of taylor the director attempts without much success to address the issue of nuclear risk and the nuclear threat in the midst of the cold war the idea gets across but the execution is disastrous with this story of science fiction mutants with telepathic powers that is anything but intelligent thoughtprovoking science fiction thankfully the fatalistic ending attempts to raise the bar but it is impossible to salvage such a rotten script sorry for the huge chunk of text but at least it has the advantage of being longer than the scripts for new kingdom the two from rank d all combined looking forward to hearing your opinions and tier lists on the subject

how i design software architecture hello reddit i wanted to share an educational deep dive into the programming workflow i developed for myself that finally allowed me to tackle huge complex features without introducing massive technical debt for context i used to struggle with tools like cursor and claude code they were great for small wellscoped iterations but as soon as the conceptual complexity and scope of a change grew my workflows started to break down it wasnt that the tools literally couldnt touch 1015 files it was that i was asking them to execute big fuzzy refactors without a clear staged plan like many people i went deep into the whole rules ecosystem cursor rules agentmd files skills mcps and all sorts of yamlmarkdowndriven configuration the disappointing realization was that most decisions werent actually driven by intelligence from the live codebase and largecontext reasoning but by a rigid set of rules i had written earlier over time i flipped this completely instead of forcing the models to follow an evergrowing list of brittle instructions i let the code lead the system infers intent and patterns from the actual repository and existing code becomes the real source of truth i eventually deleted most of those rule files and docs because they were going stale faster than i could maintain them instead of one giant doeverything prompt i keep the setup simple and transparent the core of the system is a small library of xml formatted prompts the prompts themselves are written with sections like identity role implementationplan and steps and they spell out exactly what the model should look at and how to shape the final output some of them are very simple like pathfinder which just returns a list of file paths or textimprovement and taskrefinement which return cleaned up descriptions as plain text others like implementationplan and implementationplanmerge define a strict xml schema for structured implementation plans so that every step file path and operation lands in the same place taken together they cover the stages of my planning pipeline from selecting folders and files to refining the task to producing and merging detailed implementation plans in the end there is no black box it is just a handful of explicit prompts and the xml or plain text they produce which i can read and understand at a glance not a swarm of opaque agents doing whoknowswhat behind the scenes my new approach revolves around the motto intelligencedriven development i stop focusing on rapid code completion and instead focus on rigorous architectural planning and governance i now reliably develop very sophisticated systems often getting to 95 correctness in almost one shot here is a stepbystep breakdown of my fivestage plancentric workflow my fivestage workflow for architectural rigor stage 1 crystallize the specification the biggest source of bugs is ambiguous requirements i start here to ensure the ai gets a crystalclear task definition 1 rapid capture i often use voice dictation because i found it is about 10x faster than typing out my initial thoughts i pipe the raw audio through a dedicated transcription specialist prompt so the output comes back as clean readable text rather than a messy stream of speech 2 contextual input if the requirements came from a meeting i even upload transcripts or recordings from places like microsoft teams i use advanced analysis to extract specification requirements decisions and action items from both the audio and visual content 3 task refinement this is crucial i use ai not just for grammar fixes but for task refinement a dedicated textimprovement taskrefinement pair of prompts rewrites my rough description for clarity and then explicitly looks for implied requirements edge cases and missing technical details this frontloaded analysis drastically reduces the chance of costly rework later one painful lesson from my earlier experiments outofdate documentation is actively harmful if you keep shoveling stale md files and handwritten rules into the prompt youre just teaching the model the wrong thing models like gpt5 and gemini 25 pro are extremely good at picking up subtle patterns directly from real code tiny needles in a huge haystack so instead of trying to encode all my design decisions into documents i rely on them to read the code and infer how the system actually behaves today stage 2 targeted context discovery once the specification is clear i strictly limit the code the model can see dumping an entire repository into a model has never even been on the table for me it wouldnt fit into the context window would be insanely expensive in tokens and would completely dilute the useful signal in practice ive always seen much better results from giving the model a small sharply focused slice of the codebase what actually provides that focused slice is not a single regex pass but a fourstage filefinderworkflow orchestrated by a workflow engine each stage builds on the previous one and is driven by a dedicated system prompt 1 root folder selection stage 1 of the workflow a rootfolderselection prompt sees a shallow directory tree up to two levels deep for the project and any configured external folders together with the task description the model acts like a smart router it picks only the root folders that are actually relevant and uses hierarchical intelligence if an entire subtree is relevant it picks the parent folder and if only parts are relevant it picks just those subdirectories the result is a curated set of root directories that dramatically narrows the search space before any file content is read 2 patternbased file discovery stage 2 for each selected root processed in parallel with a small concurrency limit a regexfilefilter prompt gets a directory tree scoped to that root and the task description instead of one big regex it generates pattern groups where each group has a pathpattern contentpattern and negativepathpattern within a group path and content must both match between groups results are ored together the engine then walks the filesystem gitaware respecting gitignore applies these patterns skips binaries validates utf8 ratelimits io and returns a list of locally filtered files that look promising for this task 3 aipowered relevance assessment stage 3 the next stage reads the actual contents of all patternmatched files and passes them in chunks to a filerelevanceassessment prompt chunking is based on real file sizes and model context windows each chunk uses only about 60 of the models input window so there is room for instructions and task context oversized files get their own chunks the model then performs deep semantic analysis to decide which files are truly relevant to the task all suggested paths are validated against the filesystem and normalized the result is an aifiltered deduplicated set of files that are relevant in practice not just by pattern 4 extended discovery stage 4 finally an extendedpathfinder stage looks for any critical files that might still be missing it takes the aifiltered files as previously identified files plus a scoped directory tree and the file contents and asks the model questions like what other files are critically important for this task given these ones this is where it finds test files local configuration files related utilities and other helpers that hang off the alreadyidentified files all new paths are validated and normalized then combined with the earlier list avoiding duplicates this stage is conservative by design it only adds files when there is a strong reason across these four stages the workflowstate carries intermediate data selected root directories locally filtered files aifiltered files so each step has the right context the result is a final list of maybe 515 files that are actually important for the task out of thousands of candidates selected based on project structure real contents and semantic relevance not just hardcoded rules stage 3 multimodel architectural planning this is where the magic happens and technical debt is prevented this stage is powered by a heavyduty implementationplan architect prompt that only plans it never writes code directly its entire job is to look at the selected files understand the existing architecture consider multiple ways forward and then emit a structured machineusable plan i do not trust one single model output i seek consensus from multiple experts 1 multiple perspectives i leverage a multimodel planning engine to generate implementation plans simultaneously from several leading models like gpt5 and gemini 25 pro the implementationplan prompt forces each model into an explicit metaplanning protocol they must explore 23 different architectural approaches list risks and reason about how well each option fits the existing patterns 2 architectural exploration because my custom system prompt mandates it each model must consider 23 different architectural approaches for the task eg a service layer approach vs an apifirst approach and identify the highestrisk aspects and mitigation strategies while doing that they lean heavily on the code snippets i selected in stage 2 models like gpt5 and gemini 25 pro are particularly good at noticing subtle patterns and invariants in those small slices of code this lets me see different valid approaches in standardized format 3 synthesis i then evaluate and rate the plans based on their architectural appropriateness for my codebase synthesizing them into a single superior implementation blueprint when i generate multiple independent plans a separate implementationplanmerge prompt acts as a chief architect that merges them into one coherent strategy while preserving the best ideas from each this ensemble approach acts as an automated robustness check reducing susceptibility to singlemodel hallucination or failure stage 4 humanintheloop governance this is the point where i stop generating new ideas and start choosing between them instead of one final plan i usually ask the system for several competing implementation plans under the hood each plan is just xml with the same standardized schema same sections same structure same kind of filelevel steps the ui then renders them as separate plans that i can flip through with simple arrows at the bottom of the screen because every plan follows the same format my brain doesnt have to reorient every time i can 1 flip between plans quickly i move back and forth between plan 1 plan 2 plan 3 with arrow keys and the layout stays identical only the ideas change 2 compare likeforlike i end up reading the same parts of each plan the highlevel summary the filebyfile steps the risky bits in the same positions that makes it very easy to spot where the approaches differ which one touches fewer files which one simplifies the data flow which one carries less migration risk 3 focus on architecture not formatting because the xml is standardized the ui can highlight just the important bits for me i dont waste time parsing formatting or wording i can stay in architect mode and think purely about tradeoffs 4 mix and tweak if plan 2 has a better data model but plan 3 has a cleaner integration path i can adjust the steps directly or mentally merge them into a final variant while i am reviewing there is also a small floating merge instructions window attached to the plans as i go through each candidate plan i can type short notes like prefer this data model keep pagination from plan 1 avoid touching auth here or plan 3s migration steps are safer that floating panel becomes my running commentary about what i actually want at the end i trigger a final merge step it feeds the xml content of all the plans i marked as valid plus my merge instructions into a dedicated implementationplanmerge architect prompt that merge step rates the individual plans understands where they agree and disagree and often combines parts of multiple plans into a single more precise and more complete blueprint the result is a final consolidated plan that actually reflects the best pieces of everything i have seen not just the opinion of a single model in a single run only after that do i move on to execution stage 5 secure execution only after the validated merged plan is approved does the implementation occur i keep the execution as close as possible to the planning context by running everything through an integrated terminal that lives in the same ui as the plans that way i do not have to juggle windows or copy things around the plan is on one side the terminal is right there next to it 1 oneclick prompts and plans the terminal has a small toolbar of customizable frequently used prompts that i can insert with a single click i can also paste the merged implementation plan into the prompt area with one click so the full context goes straight into the terminal without manual copypaste 2 bound execution from there i use whatever coding agent or cli i prefer like claude code or similar but always with the merged plan and my standard instructions as the backbone the terminal becomes the bridge that assigns the planning layer to the actual execution layer 3 history in one place all commands and responses stay in that same view tied mentally to the plan i just approved if something looks off i can scroll back compare with the plan and either adjust the instructions or go back a stage and refine the plan itself the important part is that the terminal is not magic it is just a very convenient way to keep planning and execution glued together the agent executes but the merged plan and my own judgment stay firmly in charge i found that this disciplined approach is what truly unlocks speed since the process is focused on correctness and architectural assurance the return on investment is massive one saved production incident pays for months of usage in summary i stopped letting the ai be the architect and started using it as a sophisticated multiperspective planning consultant by forcing it to debate architectural options and reviewing every file path before execution i maintain the clean architecture i need without drowning in an evergrowing pile of brittle rules and outofdate md documentation this workflow is like building a skyscraper i spend significant time on the blueprints stages 13 get multiple expert opinions and have the client me sign off on every detail phase 4 only then do i let the construction crew the coding agent start guaranteeing the final structure is sound and meets the specification
